The person being cared for must receive a qualifying benefit, eg Personal Independence Payment, Disability Living Allowance at the middle or highest rate, or Armed Forces Independence Payment.

modules.title: Live service usage
modules.description: Live number of users on any page within the service
info: Shows the estimated number of users currently accessing the service on GOV.UK.

modules.title: Claims breakdown
modules.description: Paper form and digital applications over time
info: Shows the number of successful claims for Carer's Allowance, broken down by channel
Paper form: applications made using a paper form

modules.title: Digital take-up
info: Data source: Department for Work and Pensions
Digital take-up measures the percentage of completed applications that are made through a digital channel versus non-digital channels.

modules.title: Completion rate
info: Completion rate measures the proportion of people who started a claim and were able to complete it.
It is calculated as percentage of unique visitors who arrived at the final page of the service out of those who arrived at the start page.

modules.title: Users at each step
modules.description: Number of users who completed important steps of the transaction last week
info: The total number of users who arrived at each step.
Number of users is measured using the count of unique events from each step.

modules.title: Service availability
info: Page load time measures the time taken for a sample page within the service to load.
Uptime measures the percentage of time that the service was observed to be available.
